description: Drawing of three young children, a boy, girl, and infant inside a doorway, who look outside at a man and a woman fighting in front of the house. The children cry and cover their faces with their hands. The man has one hand outstretched and gestures toward the woman with the other. The woman points at the man with one hand and in the other holds up a long-handled spoon as if to strike him. A large pot lies between them, broken and spilling its contents onto the ground. Across the street, another person can be seen standing in a doorway, watching the fight.

description: Black and white cartoon drawing of a young black woman wearing a school uniform standing on a road between two black men. One man, dressed in shorts and a t-shirt, stands just off the road and gestures toward the forest. The other, dressed in slacks, dress shoes, and a jacket, offers her cash and points in the direction of a road sign labeled "Muli Madyo Resthouse". She holds up a hand protectively in each direction, refusing each man. Logos for Malawi National AIDS Control Programme and the STAFH Project appear at the bottom. The poster verso includes Chewa text.
